statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: The Charlotte Hornets weren't worried about style points after winning their 12th road game of the season, a 78-73 win over the Spurs in San Antonio.
article.headline: Duncan's huge numbers can't save Spurs

images.name: Lynch_George 012902 inline
images.caption: Spurs forward Malik Rose, left, blocks a shot by Hornets forward George Lynch, but San Antonio fell in the end.

article.linkText: Hornets topple struggling Spurs in Alamodome
article.story:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) -- The Charlotte Hornets weren't worried about style points after winning their 12th road game of the season. "It wasn't a pretty game, but we found a way to win," guard Baron Davis said Charlotte's 78-73 victory over the San Antonio Spurs on Tuesday night. "It was a defensive battle that went our way." Reserve Bryce Drew scored 15 points, Elden Campbell added 13 and P.J. Brown 10 to help Charlotte snap a two-game losing streak and improve to 12-11 away from home. Tim Duncan had 29 points and 21 rebounds for San Antonio, which was without injured center David Robinson. The Spurs were 3-of-22 from the field in the fourth quarter in their lowest-scoring game of the season. "It's frustrating to play like this," San Antonio guard Charles Smith said. "Neither team could hit their shots. When they finally hit a few, it took the fire out of us." Minutes after the game, the Alamodome was evacuated because of a bomb threat called into a city emergency dispatcher. Authorities let people re-enter the building after a one-hour search, with facility manager Kevin Duvall saying no explosives were found. "We brought in the dogs, assessed the situation, and everything is OK," Duvall said. While San Antonio missed its first 13 shots in the fourth quarter, Charlotte was able to take a 72-63 lead on Drew's 3-pointer and Brown's free throws with 7:24 to play. The Spurs rallied with a 7-0 run to make it 72-70 on Steve Smith's 3-pointer with 3:38 to play. San Antonio cut the lead to 74-73 on Tony Parker's layup and a free throw by Duncan with 45.5 seconds to play. But Brown and Stacey Augmon sealed it by each making two free throws over the final 13.5 seconds. San Antonio, which lost its third straight home game, could get no closer than five points. "The only thing we can do is stay positive," Charles Smith said. "Three straight losses at home is three losses. We can't let that carry over to our next game." Charlotte opened the third quarter with a 10-3 run and led 54-47 on Baron Davis' breakaway dunk with 7:55 remaining in the period. San Antonio answered with an 8-0 run to lead 55-54 on two free throws by Duncan with 5:37 to play in the quarter. The Hornets headed into the fourth quarter leading 65-63. After leading by as many as 12 points in the first quarter, San Antonio was outscored 21-15 in the second quarter and trailed 44-43 at halftime. Duncan led the Spurs with 20 first half points, while Drew had 12 for the Hornets.

Game notes
Duncan had his 35th double-double of the season, and 255th of his career. ... Duncan has scored 20 or more points in 25 straight games ... San Antonio leads the all-time series with Charlotte by an 17-12 count ... The Spurs have won five of the last seven meetings with the Hornets. ... San Antonio Spurs center David Robinson sat out Tuesday game due to a right quad contusion. ... Robinson, who played in all 42 games this season for the Spurs, originally was injured in the first quarter of San Antonio's 90-82 victory over the Golden State Warriors on Jan. 26. The 12-year veteran is averaging 11 points and 7.8 rebounds.
